page.title: 01Local History
page.content: The area is crossed by a Roman road which leads to the Roman baths at Wall a few miles north. The road is not continuous now but several sections are followed by modern roads. Remains of mills and mill ponds can be seen. Two families have left their names on the map.The Badgers in Badgers Bank Road, and the Bickleys on a plaque at the end of Clarence Road. This says: "Here on the first of August 1797 John Bickley and the horse which he rode were struck dead by lightning. Happily he was an amiable youth".
